author: George Bellshaw
title: Arsene Wenger would never bring Roy Keane to Arsenal, says Paul Merson
text:
Is Wenger purposefully avoiding signing players with opinions? (Picture: AFP/Getty) Paul Merson believes Arsene Wenger would never sign a player like Roy Keane because he does not like players answering back to him.
The former Aston Villa and Arsenal playmaker believes his former boss surrounds himself with ‘nice people’ in order to maintain control of the club.
Ozil: My future does NOT depend on Wenger staying at Arsenal Merson won two First Division titles, an FA Cup and a League Cup during his time at Highbury before Wenger arrived and believes the atmosphere in his days at Arsenal was full of big personalities.
Keane was confrontational but a serial winner (Picture: Getty) However, he’s now convinced Wenger is shying away from stars in the mould of the Manchester United legend to avoid a confrontational dressing room.
‘Arsene wouldn’t have a Roy Keane playing for him,’ Merson told Sky Sports.
‘He wouldn’t have a Mark Bosnich playing for him. They have opinions.

Ozil: This is the one thing I want to do before leaving Arsenal 
‘If players aren’t playing well, they’d get up and say they won’t accept that. This manager doesn’t want that.
‘He has surrounded himself with nice people. Nice people don’t always win trophies. There was a fight at training every week when I played at Arsenal.’
